intro: Bridelia polystachya, commonly known as the African bridelia, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
